Since 1936, Afghanistan has contributed to the growth of the "Olympic Movement". Olympics.org, "Factsheet: The Olympic Movement"; retrieved 2012-7-28. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Afghanistan is AFG. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-8-16. ==History== The Afghanistan National Olympic Committee was formed in 1935. It was recognized by the International Olympic Committee in 1936.Afghanistan; retrieved 2012-7-28. Afghanistan's team first competed at the 1936 Summer Olympics in Berlin. In 1999, Afghanistan was banned from the Olympics due to its discrimination against women under Taliban rule. In the 2004 Summer Olympics two women, Robina Muqim Yaar and Friba Razayee, were the first women to compete for Afghanistan at the Olympics. Mehboba Ahdyar, a woman in the 2008 Summer Olympics had death threats because of her plan to be in the Games. ==Medalists== ===Summer games=== Medal Name Games Sport Event 2008 Beijing Taekwondo Men's 58 kg 2012 London Taekwondo Men's 68 kg ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes ==References== ==Other websites== * Afghanistan National Olympic Committee * Afghan Sports History * Afghanistan profile at London2012.com Category:Afghan society and culture Category:Nations at the Olympics Category:National sports teams of Afghanistan
